title: Vintage Boxing Champions
description: Step into the ring and recall the heavyweight heroes and legendary bouts that captivated fans from the 1940s through the 1980s!

questions.question: Who was known as 'The Greatest' and famously proclaimed 'I am the greatest' after defeating Sonny Liston in 1964?
The 'Thrilla in Manila' in 1975 was a legendary bout between Muhammad Ali and which opponent?
Joe Louis held the heavyweight championship for a record-breaking stretch. How many consecutive title defenses did he make?
The 'Rumble in the Jungle' took place in 1974 in which African country?
Which boxer was widely considered 'pound for pound' the greatest fighter of all time and held the middleweight title five times?
Rocky Marciano retired undefeated in 1956 with how many professional wins?
Which boxer's real name was Walker Smith Jr. before he became a legendary champion?
Muhammad Ali's strategy of leaning back on the ropes to tire George Foreman in their 1974 fight was called what?
Which boxer was known as 'The Brockton Blockbuster' and held the heavyweight title from 1952 to 1956?
The famous 'No Mas' fight in 1980 involved Sugar Ray Leonard and which opponent who quit mid-fight?
Joe Louis' 1938 rematch with Max Schmeling, which Louis won in the first round, was seen as a symbolic victory against what?
Which welterweight champion of the 1980s was nicknamed 'Hit Man' and fought in several super fights?
Before becoming Muhammad Ali, what was the boxing champion's birth name?
The 1971 'Fight of the Century' at Madison Square Garden was the first bout between Ali and which undefeated champion?
Which middleweight champion of the 1980s was known as 'Marvelous' and fought in one of the greatest bouts ever against Thomas Hearns in 1985?
